sub_topic: The Hausdorff dimension of the Koch curve.
message_1: What is the Hausdorff dimension of the Koch curve? Round your answer to two decimal places.
message_2:
The Hausdorff dimension of the Koch curve can be calculated using the formula:

Hausdorff dimension = log(N) / log(1/s)

where N is the number of self-similar pieces and s is the scaling factor.

For the Koch curve, there are N = 4 self-similar pieces, and each piece is scaled down by a factor of s = 1/3.

Hausdorff dimension = log(4) / log(1/3) â‰ˆ 1.2619

Rounded to two decimal places, the Hausdorff dimension of the Koch curve is approximately 1.26.
